content:
• Friday, March 30, 2012
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD +4.5%), which rallied today after its TH-302 drug received...

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD +4.5%), which rallied today after its TH-302 drug received orphan status from the FDA, falls 2.3% AH after providing detailed clinical results for the drug's Phase 2b trials, which evaluate its efficacy in treating pancreatic cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 PM | 4 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +7.1%) ends the day with a healthy gain, as optimism about Thorsten...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +7.1%) ends the day with a healthy gain, as optimism about Thorsten Heins' willingness to clean house and explore options outweighs pessimism about bleak results and discontinued guidance. The rally comes even though sell-side opinions are almost uniformly bearish (one more way in which RIM is the anti-Apple), and buyout speculation is largely downbeat. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -10.5% AH after revising its Q4 revenue downward by $14.3M, and its EPS by...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -10.5% AH after revising its Q4 revenue downward by $14.3M, and its EPS by $0.04, on account of an increase in the company's refund reserve accrual. Details about the increase, which relate to a sales mix shift, are provided in Groupon's just-filed 10-K, which also includes a disclosure of "material weakness" in internal controls. The company is reaffirming its Q1 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -4.4%) adds to yesterday's big losses after poor Q4 results, and pundits ask how...

    Best Buy (BBY -4.4%) adds to yesterday's big losses after poor Q4 results, and pundits ask how it can compete with Amazon and the broader implications for how consumers buy technology (I, II, III). UBS asks: "Will it work? [What will] convince the market that the company is serious about taking steep steps to evolve with the changing marketplace... in reality, only time will tell."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • JNY

    The Jones Group (JNY +7.4%) pops after SunTrust upgraded the shares to Buy ahead of its April 25...

    The Jones Group (JNY +7.4%) pops after SunTrust upgraded the shares to Buy ahead of its April 25 report, citing expectations for traction in its Spring product line and benefits from its restructuring initiatives.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • TEVA

    Shares of Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +2.2%) move up after the company announces the launch of the...

    Shares of Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +2.2%) move up after the company announces the launch of the authorized generic version of Provigil, a drug used to treat excessive sleepiness caused by narcolepsy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • MOV

    Movado (MOV +1.3%) gains after Citigroup increases its price target to $28 from $24 on the...

    Movado (MOV +1.3%) gains after Citigroup increases its price target to $28 from $24 on the company's better-than-expected Q4 EPS yesterday. The firm reiterates its Buy rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +5.3%) and Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +0.3%), competing to win U.S. regulatory...

    Vivus (VVUS +5.3%) and Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +0.3%), competing to win U.S. regulatory approval for weight-loss treatments, probably won’t be affected by an FDA advisory panel’s recommendation for heart-risk studies, an FDA spokesperson tells Bloomberg: “It’s unlikely that the discussions over the past couple days will impact any existing applications." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -4.4%) names controller John Regan as its new CFO, replacing current...

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -4.4%) names controller John Regan as its new CFO, replacing current CFO Philip Cook who plans to resign next month after the company files its 2011 annual report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • CNC

    Health insurers show continued strength on sentiment that the Supreme Court may significantly...

    Health insurers show continued strength on sentiment that the Supreme Court may significantly overturn Obamacare, boosted by a Jefferies note saying a court ruling that would overturn part of the law that would order states to expand Medicaid programs probably won’t have long-lasting effects on insurers such as CNC +3.6% and AGP +3%. Also: WLP +3.5%, CVH +3%, WCG +2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -1.6%) is underperforming today on above-average volume. The Fair Labor...

    Apple (AAPL -1.6%) is underperforming today on above-average volume. The Fair Labor Association's discovery of "non-compliances" at Foxconn's Chinese facilities, together with Apple and Foxconn's agreement to address the issues via new hiring and other measures, could have investors worried Apple will see higher manufacturing costs and lower margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 42 Comments
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM +2%) moves higher after announcing a conference call to discuss results from its...

    StemCells (STEM +2%) moves higher after announcing a conference call to discuss results from its Phase I clinical trial of HuCNS-SC - purified human neural stem cells used as a potential treatment for PMD, a rare hypo-myelination disorder in children.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • CACH

    Cache (OTC:CACH -10.4%) sinks after its Q4 meets expectations on revenue but misses on a per...

    Cache (OTC:CACH -10.4%) sinks after its Q4 meets expectations on revenue but misses on a per share basis. The company posted weaker-than-expected profit as promotional activity pressured margins. The company also warns on the current quarter, saying that lower sales for special-occasion apparel and some spring merchandise forced it to increase promotional activity, which will likely pressure Q1 margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • KATE

    Shares of Liz Claiborne (LIZ) roar 15.3% higher to $13.70 off of a report that the retailer is...

    Shares of Liz Claiborne (LIZ) roar 15.3% higher to $13.70 off of a report that the retailer is talking to P-E firms with a goal of nabbing $20 a share from an acquirer.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • KND

    Kindred Healthcare (KND -3%) and Select Medical (SEM -3.5%) slump after Susquehanna cut the...

    Kindred Healthcare (KND -3%) and Select Medical (SEM -3.5%) slump after Susquehanna cut the health-facility operators to Neutral earlier this morning. The firm sees the stocks remaining range-bound until there is greater clarity on potential Medicare reimbursement challenges facing the companies. Wells Fargo also cut both companies to Outperform as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • ZAZA

    Small-time oil producer ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA +22%) soars after announcing plans to expand the...

    Small-time oil producer ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA +22%) soars after announcing plans to expand the size of its operations in Texas' Eaglebine formation to 144K gross acres, courtesy of a deal with Range Resources (NYSE:RRC). Also helping is a positive mention on CNBC's Fast Money Halftime Report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • TIBX

    In spite of beating FQ1 estimates and announcing a $300M stock buyback, Tibco (TIBX -5.6%) is...

    In spite of beating FQ1 estimates and announcing a $300M stock buyback, Tibco (TIBX -5.6%) is selling off, thanks to the richly-valued middleware maker's guidance for FQ2 revenue of $240M-$244M and EPS of $0.22-$0.23 (consensus is for $242.2M and $0.23). UBS (Buy) is staying positive: it likes the increase seen in Tibco's average deal size, and expects its huge sales investments to pay off in 2H. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • LUFK

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK +3.5%) rallies after Dahlman Rose starts coverage with a Buy and $96 PT....

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK +3.5%) rallies after Dahlman Rose starts coverage with a Buy and $96 PT. The firm thinks price increases for Lufkin's aritifical lift equipment for oil production will drive margin expansion and EPS upside, as well as lead to higher guidance. It also thinks greater operational efficiencies could boost margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • DISCA

    Discovery Communications (DISCA +1.8%) gains after Lazard Capital upped the shares to Buy...

    Discovery Communications (DISCA +1.8%) gains after Lazard Capital upped the shares to Buy earlier today, based on domestic momentum in at Discovery ID, network expansion globally and domestic higher ratings at Discovery Network.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • GPN

    A number of payment processing stocks are getting tossed around after news breaks that Global...

    A number of payment processing stocks are getting tossed around after news breaks that Global Payments could be the culprit behind the security breach of credit card data. Decliners: HPY -2.5%, MGI -0.8%, NEWT -1.4%, FLT -0.7%, UEPS -2.0%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • DIS

    Disney (DIS +1.4%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Lazard Capital, citing secular...

    Disney (DIS +1.4%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Lazard Capital, citing secular positive program fee growth, and a strong net cash position that can be used for repurchases or acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • GPN

    Trading is halted in Global Payments (GPN -9.1%) as the credit card industry investigates a data...

    Trading is halted in Global Payments (GPN -9.1%) as the credit card industry investigates a data breach that affected Visa and MasterCard. GPN shares had dropped as much as 13% when trading stopped in New York pending further news.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO -4.2%) is the S&P's leading loser so far after Credit Suisse cuts 2012...

    Valero Energy (VLO -4.2%) is the S&P's leading loser so far after Credit Suisse cuts 2012 earnings estimates, citing "weak retail margins, VLO-specific refinery maintenance and weak ethanol margins. With a potentially sluggish patch for the economy, refiner shares could consolidate here."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • OC

    Goldman ups the Building Products group to Neutral citing improving sales trends and easing...

    Goldman ups the Building Products group to Neutral citing improving sales trends and easing commodity prices. The firm's top pick in the space is Buy rated Owens Corning (OC +1%) given its pricing power, and its least favorites remain Sell rated Whirlpool (WHR +0.5%) and USG (USG -1.8%) given weak fundamentals.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • WYN

    Wyndham (WYN +3%) gets a lift from a Goldman upgrade to Buy, citing improving core fundamentals,...

    Wyndham (WYN +3%) gets a lift from a Goldman upgrade to Buy, citing improving core fundamentals, inventory improvements, continued share buybacks, and strong consumer demand. The firm raises estimates above the Street and its price target to $55 from $45.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • ENPH

    After pricing its 9M share IPO at $6, Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) opened at $7.40 and is now...

    After pricing its 9M share IPO at $6, Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) opened at $7.40 and is now trading at $7.32, up 22%. That gives gives the maker of solar microinverters a valuation of $273M. Enphase generated 2011 revenue of $149.5M (+143% Y/Y), but also a net loss of $32.3M. Its solutions convert power more efficiently than traditional solar inverters from the likes of SATC and PWER, but are also costlier. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 4 Comments
  • XRTX

    Xyratex’s (XRTX -10.2%) Q1 earnings surged on improved margins and lower input costs, but...

    Xyratex’s (XRTX -10.2%) Q1 earnings surged on improved margins and lower input costs, but shares are sliding due to weaker revenue on supply problems and downward Q2 guidance. While still liking XTRX long-term, Needham downgrades shares to Hold from Buy on valuation, slightly reduced FY 2013 results, and absence of any apparent catalyst to move estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • IMGN

    Shares of ImmunoGen (IMGN +4.1%) lose traction after shooting up over 12% on positive results...

    Shares of ImmunoGen (IMGN +4.1%) lose traction after shooting up over 12% on positive results from partner Roche for its experimental breast cancer drug. The rally got cut short in part by the opinion that the market value on IMGN is "significantly" too high based on the small 5% royalty tied to Roche's drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM -8.8%) and Annie's (BNNY -3.6%) cool off after delivering scorching IPOs...

    Millennial Media (MM -8.8%) and Annie's (BNNY -3.6%) cool off after delivering scorching IPOs this week (I, II) that were bolstered by relatively small floats. Nonetheless, shares are still up 75% and 92%, respectively, from their IPO prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • SIRI

    Shares of Sirius XM (SIRI +4.3%) show a pesky gain after reports swirl around that Liberty Media...

    Shares of Sirius XM (SIRI +4.3%) show a pesky gain after reports swirl around that Liberty Media (LMCA +1.1%) is closing in on adding to its ownership stake in the company and vying to gain "de facto" control of some Sirius' licenses and assets via an investor agreement between the firms.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 4 Comments
  • SBSAA

    Shares of Spanish Broadcasting Systems (SBSA +41.1%) skyrocket after the firm reports that it...

    Shares of Spanish Broadcasting Systems (SBSA +41.1%) skyrocket after the firm reports that it quadrupled profits in Q4 compared to last year. The company says it increased national radio sales in the New York and Puerto Rico markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN -6.3%) tumbles after Oppenheimer downgrades shares to Perform. The firm is...

    InvenSense (INVN -6.3%) tumbles after Oppenheimer downgrades shares to Perform. The firm is worried about InvenSense's May 15 lockup expiration, which will result in 45% of its float being available, and thinks the motion sensor chip market is more open to competition than previously believed. Both Microsoft's Kinect and rival chipmakers such as STM and MXIM are seen as threats. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • DANG

    Shares of Dangdang (DANG +5.5%) run higher on high trading volume after the company locks in a...

    Shares of Dangdang (DANG +5.5%) run higher on high trading volume after the company locks in a deal to offer Gome Online's products in its online marketplace.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • TEL

    Goldman Sachs upgrades TE Connectivity (TEL +3.1%) to Conviction Buy and takes its price target...

    Goldman Sachs upgrades TE Connectivity (TEL +3.1%) to Conviction Buy and takes its price target on shares up to $45. The firm says TEL makes a good play for betting on electronics growth in the auto industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • FINL

    Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) -8.2% premarket despite reporting a 22% jump in Q4 earnings, as the...

    Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) -8.2% premarket despite reporting a 22% jump in Q4 earnings, as the retailer guides Q1 and FY13 EPS below consensus. Analysts had been bullish about FINL’s prospects as they touted an expected focus on licensed apparel, product launches tied to the Olympics and the growth of a specialty running chain the company had bought last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen (NASDAQ:IMGN) +12.9% premarket after drug partner Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) reports positive...

    ImmunoGen (NASDAQ:IMGN) +12.9% premarket after drug partner Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) reports positive results from a late-stage study of its experimental breast cancer drug T-DM1, paving the way to file the potential blockbuster drug for regulatory approval in Europe and the U.S. later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD) +8.3% premarket, adding to the gains seen yesterday on account of M&A...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD) +8.3% premarket, adding to the gains seen yesterday on account of M&A speculation. KIT's recent management/board shakeup, along with the weak performance of its shares over the last 15 months, has many thinking the IPTV software firm may finally be open to a deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • MSFT

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD) move up 2.9% premarket after Susquehanna raises its rating on the...

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD) move up 2.9% premarket after Susquehanna raises its rating on the company to Positive from Neutral. The company has also seen some insider buying

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • IMGN

    Premarket gainers: IMGN +13%. OTC:KITD +9%. THLD + 4 ARNA +4%. VVUS +3%. GLUU +3%. LNKD +3%. RIO...

    Premarket gainers: IMGN +13%. OTC:KITD +9%. THLD + 4 ARNA +4%. VVUS +3%. GLUU +3%. LNKD +3%. RIO +3%.
    Losers: FINL -8%. INVN -5%. SHPGY -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • RHHBY

    Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) unit Genentech reports positive results from a Phase III study of its...

    Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) unit Genentech reports positive results from a Phase III study of its trastuzumab emtansine breast cancer drug. The study showed patients taking the treatment lived significantly longer without their disease getting worse.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • LULU

    UBS initiates coverage of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) with a Buy rating and lofty $91 price target....

    UBS initiates coverage of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) with a Buy rating and lofty $91 price target. Shares +1.68% premarket, +56.7% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • MOS

    Goldman Sachs makes the call to buy shares of Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) on weakness with its view that...

    Goldman Sachs makes the call to buy shares of Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) on weakness with its view that the long-term story on the company remains positive and value will eventually be unlocked. Analysts with the firm raised their price target on shares to $71 from $67. Shares +0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) receives FDA orphan drug designation for its TH-302 sarcoma...

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) receives FDA orphan drug designation for its TH-302 sarcoma treatment. Shares +6.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) move up 4.2% in premarket trading as the dust still clears from a...

    Shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) move up 4.2% in premarket trading as the dust still clears from a FDA panel that had implications for weight-loss drug Qnexa. Yesterday's roller coaster ride for VVUS may have been a bit of a case of "itchy trader fingers" with the final word on FDA approval for Qnexa still up in the air.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 AM | 3 Comments
